Review Title: Three Stars Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Masterpiece Contemporary: Place of Execution Review Date: 2016/03/15 Categories: Suspense, Drama Product Description: ['On a freezing December night in 1963, 13-year-old Alison Carter took her dog for a walk on the moors in Scardale, a secluded Derbyshire hamlet, and was never seen again. For newly-promoted Detective Inspector George Bennett (Lee Ingleby), his first missing persons case his first chance to prove himself to his new bosses ultimately launched a superstar career. As the entire country watched his investigation, Bennett s obsession with the Carter case turned up enough evidence to see his suspect hanged. But though he was hailed a hero by the people of Scardale, and by his peers, the missing body of Alison Carter left a lingering cloud. It is that cloud that compels controversial filmmaker Catherine Heathcote (Juliet Stevenson) to turn her camera to Bennett more than four decades later. But when the film about this notorious case leads her to something more sinister, Catherine struggles to understand why questions from forty years ago have different answers today. Based on the novel by award-winning author Val McDermid, Place Of Execution is a gripping psychological thriller, told in the present and the past, that blurs the line between reality and illusion.'] Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['David Percival'], 'Producers': ['PBS'], 'Starring': ['Lee Ingleby', 'Emma Cunniffe', 'Philip Jackson']} Review Text: Very good. raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual shows a consistent preference for high-quality entertainment, with ratings predominantly around 3.0 to 5.0, revealing a moderate level of satisfaction. The common themes in product purposes lean towards drama and psychological thrillers, with a noted interest in narratives that include social issues and complex characters. 

Quality preferences indicate a favor for productions featuring strong writing and engaging casts, as well as a tendency to appreciate diverse audio language options and subtitle availability. However, moments of dissatisfaction surface, particularly when endings are perceived as implausible. Price sensitivity appears low, as the individual frequently engages with products of higher average ratings regardless of cost.

Overall, this person values well-crafted stories with compelling performances, demonstrates a balanced attitude towards content advisories, and shows particular interest in narratives presenting genuine human experiences and relatable dilemmas.
